008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.geometry.line;
010
011
012import java.util.Locale;
013
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * This class represents a straight line in Hessian normal form, i.e., x *
019 * cos(angle) + y * sin(angle) = radius. It is merely a subclass of
020 * {@link AlgebraicLine} with a different constructor and getter methods for
021 * angle and radius. Instances are immutable. Reference point is (0,0). See Sec.
022 * 10.1 and Appendix F.1 of [1] for details.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
026 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
027 * </p>
028 * 
029 * @author WB
030 * @version 2022/11/18
031 * 
032 */
033public class HessianLine extends AlgebraicLine {
034        
035        // static factory methods ----------------------------------------
036        
037        public static HessianLine from(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2) {
038                return new HessianLine(AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2));
039        }
040        
041        // constructors --------------------------------------------------
042
043        /**
044         * Constructor. Creates a new {@link HessianLine} instance with the
045         * specified angle and radius.
046         * Note that this really creates a normalized {@link AlgebraicLine}.
047         * The values returned by {@link #getAngle()} and {@link #getRadius()}
048         * may not be identical to the values passed to this constructor.
049         * 
050         * @param angle the line's angle
051         * @param radius the line's radius
052         */
053        public HessianLine(double angle, double radius) {
054                super(Math.cos(angle), Math.sin(angle), -radius);       // = A, B, C
055        }
056        
057        public HessianLine(double a, double b, double c) {
058                super(a, b, c);                 // creates a normalized line
059        }
060        
061        public HessianLine(AlgebraicLine al) {
062                super(al.getParameters());
063        }
064        
065        public double getAngle() {
066                return Math.atan2(B, A);
067        }
068        
069        public double getRadius() {
070                return -C;
071        }
072        
073        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
074        
075        @Override
076        public String toString() {
077                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <angle = %.3f, radius = %.3f>",
078                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), getAngle(), getRadius());
079        }
080
081}
